column4: have you installed/used the isapnptools package to configure the ISA card?
It's an old-time tool - not available in the Ubuntu repositories now. Just wondered if it may help.
there is a recent Debian package: http://www.roestock.demon.co.uk/isapnptools/
that link refers to a good article on the subject of ISA cards, and using isapnptools: http://www.linuxjournal.com/article/3269
